title: Co-op Food Admits Double Billing Error
text:
Sky News - Co-op Food Admits Double Billing Error Related Content View Photo 
A spokesman for the Co-op said the mistake was down to a "processing error" A processing error has meant that hundreds of thousands of Co-op customer have been left out of pocket. 
A spokesperson for The Co-operative Food said: “Due to a processing error customers who shopped with us or used a petrol filling station on 7 July using a credit or debit card were charged twice. 
"We would like to apologise to all those affected, and reassure customers that refunds will be made directly in to their accounts within 24 hours. 
"We will also reimburse any customers who have incurred bank charges as a result of this error. These customers should contact our customer careline.” 
The Co-op customer careline number is 0800 068 6727 . 
This error comes just weeks after new sales data revealed that John Lewis had leap-frogged the Co-op to become the UK's largest worker-owned business. 
Co-op's most recent financial results showed that food sales for 2014 had fallen by 2.1% to £7.1bn. 
Co-op have been pursuing a strategy which has seen it dispose of its larger stores and increase the number of smaller convenience stores.
